definition: to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

sentences.english: Haveing others pay your check is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付账值得炫耀，但自己埋单那才叫骄傲。

sentences.english: The Ding Dafang acknowledgement, and pay leave.
sentences.chinese: 阿丁大方承认，并付账走人。

sentences.english: Responsible for the management of accounts payables.
sentences.chinese: 负责应付账款账务管理。

sentences.english: The main part of the enterprise's accounts is accounts receivable and accounts payable.
sentences.chinese: 企业往来款的主要部分为应收账款和应付账款。
会计或应付账款相关知识。

sentences.english: Sit down with your accountant or bookkeeper to prioritize your payables.
sentences.chinese: 和您的会计师坐下来商谈您的应付账款。

sentences.english: He paid the pill by cashing in some bonds.
sentences.chinese: 他把一些证券兑换成现金付账。

sentences.english: So we could owe money, and the best example that's account payable .
sentences.chinese: 应付账款就是我们欠钱的最好的例子。

sentences.english: Please pay at the cash desk over there.
He pays by apex or with his amex card .
sentences.chinese: 他是用美国运通公司的信用卡付账的。
应付账款都记录些什么？

sentences.english: Business is business . You have to pay the bill.
sentences.chinese: 公事公办，妳是要付账的。

sentences.english: As I was paying the bill, Daniel came.
sentences.chinese: 在我付账单时，丹尼尔赶过来了。

sentences.english: We don't have to pay anything. He said he would foot the entire bill.
sentences.chinese: 我们不必付账，他说全由他埋单。

sentences.english: You can pay the bill with a cheque if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以用支票付账。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
to pay a sum of money/payment
to dine and dash/to leave without paying
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
